normalised: Why does my electricity bill always feel like a Bollywood plot twist?

unnormalised: Okay, so I know everyone’s been there. You're casually enjoying life, binge-watching some Netflix after a long day of WFH, maybe with the AC set to a comfortable 24°C. Then BAM! The electricity bill arrives, and it's like, "Surprise! You owe ₹8,500!" My mom nearly had a heart attack last month when she saw the bill – she swore we were running a Bitcoin mining operation from our 2BHK in Andheri. I checked the meter reading myself, it went from 12345 units to 12987 units in just one month! Is the meter secretly powered by a black hole?
normalised: Okay, so I know everyone’s been there. You're casually enjoying life, binge-watching some Netflix after a long day of W-F-H, maybe with the A-C set to a comfortable twenty four degree celsius. Then B-A-M! The electricity bill arrives, and it's like, "Surprise! You owe rupee eight thousand five hundred!" My mom nearly had a heart attack last month when she saw the bill – she swore we were running a Bitcoin mining operation from our two B-H-K in Andheri. I checked the meter reading myself, it went from twelve thousand three hundred and forty five units to twelve thousand nine hundred and eighty seven units in just one month! Is the meter secretly powered by a black hole?

unnormalised: Seriously though, I suspect our ceiling fan is secretly training to become a jet engine. Or maybe the fridge is holding secret raves for leftover daal at 3 AM. Last time I checked, my neighbour Sharmaji said his bill was only ₹3000 and he has a bigger flat! He suggested I switch to LED bulbs, claiming they’re 90% more efficient. Like that's gonna fix the problem of what feels like a small nuclear power plant running in my house. Perhaps I should consult a baba to exorcise the demonic appliances?
